Dear Keisha Taylor:
Attached is the Renewal Inspection Report for the above referenced agency completed
on January 16, 2024. Due to the violations of applicable licensing rules, a written
corrective action plan is required. The corrective action plan is due 15 days from the date
of this letter and must include the following:
• For any repeat violations, why the prior corrective action plan did not result
in compliance.
• How compliance with each citation will be achieved.
• Who is directly responsible for implementing the action steps in the
corrective action plan.
• Specific time frames for each citation as to when the correction will be
completed or implemented.
• How continuing compliance will be maintained once compliance is
achieved.
• The signature of the responsible party and a date.
If you fail to submit an acceptable corrective action plan, disciplinary action may result.
Please review the enclosed documentation for accuracy and contact me with any
questions. In the event that I am not available, and you need to speak to someone
immediately, please contact the area manager at 616-204-6992.

Sincerely,

III. DESCRIPTION OF FINDINGS
The agency is in compliance with all applicable rules and statutes except for the
following:
CCI Rule 400.4114 Tuberculosis screening for employees and volunteers
• (1) The licensee shall document, prior to
employment, that each employee and volunteer
who has contact with residents 4 or more hours
per week for more than 2 consecutive weeks is
free from communicable tuberculosis. Freedom
from communicable tuberculosis shall be verified
within the 1 year period before employment and
shall be verified every 1 year after the last

verification or prior to the expiration of the
current verification.
Two of twelve employee files reviewed did not have adequate documentation of
TB testing prior to hire.

VI. EVALUATION OF RENEWAL PERIOD
Maltreatment in Care
There were no substantiated incidents of maltreatment in care during this
licensing period.
Corrective Action Plan Compliance
The agency has submitted 2 corrective action plans (CAP) during this licensing
period, and compliance with each individual CAP is as follows: Special
Investigation 2023C00009281SI resulted in noncompliance of licensing rule R
400.4158.1.a.ii. The corrective action plan is currently pending approval. The
agency renewal inspection in July 2023 also resulted in a CAP due to
noncompliance with licensing rules and supported the 1st provisional license
recommendation.
The agency was placed on a 1st provisional license as a result of special
investigation 2023C0000295. The agency was successful in implementing the
corrective action plan that was approved from this investigation. Staff that were
involved in inappropriate restraint techniques and interventions standards and
those determined not to be qualified have all been terminated and not eligible for
rehire. Since going onto a 1st provisional license, the facility has made progress
and improvements into the program for the safety of youth. This includes an
adjustment in the staff to youth ratio, hired a new chief administrator, and
increased training options for staff. All corrective action plans have been
implemented and all action steps have been met in the required timeframes.
Financial Overview
The financial documents of the agency were reviewed, and no concerns were
noted.
PREA compliance (if applicable)
N/A

Chief Administrator Assessment
The Chief Administrator Assessment was completed and submitted for review.
The assessment documented areas that the agency is continuing to address via
Corrective Action Plans. The facility has been successful in demonstrating
compliance with CAP's during this review period. The assessment also indicated
an appropriate plan for continued monitoring of compliance.
Staff and Youth Interviews
A total of five staff were interviewed as a part of the renewal inspection. This
included three direct care staff, one supervisor and one administrator. No
concerns were noted, and the employees provided positive feedback regarding
the company and the improvements that they have seen over the last 6 months.
The staff reported that they have adjusted to changes and continue to work
toward creating structure and a positive environment at the agency. The
administrative staff have expressed their commitment to working with the Division
of Child Welfare Licensing and the Department of Health and Human Services for
improved outcomes for those serviced by the facility.
The facility currently has placement of 16 youth. Three youth were interviewed as
a part of the renewal inspection. All youth were able to identify positive aspects of
the program. Youth continue to report positive relationships with the staff.
Description of Agency Walk Through
A walk through of the agency was completed and no areas of concern were
noted. Damage to a window was noted and had just occurred the day prior to the
on-site visit. The chief administrator confirmed that an order for replacement had
been made and it was noted that the window was properly secured.

VII. RECOMMENDATION
Based on inspection findings the agency is not in compliance with all applicable
licensing statutes and rules. Upon receipt of an acceptable corrective action plan, it is
recommended that the agency will be issued a renewal of their regular license.
